title.narrative: The Power of Nutrition Bank-Executed Trust Fund for Nigeria

description.narrative: The Power of Nutrition’s BETF investment will support three key workstreams: enhance the delivery of nutrition interventions through new platforms by providing technical assistance to design and assess pilots across the 12 states, building an evidence base to support future iterations or scale up of successful approaches by Government; Facilitate learning between different stakeholders in nutrition across Nigeria, and; Demonstrate evidence of impact where initiatives under ANRiN are successful, facilitating course correction and fine-tuning where appropriate

This $3.9 million investment into a World Bank-Executed Trust Fund (BETF) will provide critical technical assistance to strengthen the Government of Nigeria’s capacity to deliver the $232m Accelerating Nutrition Results in Nigeria (ANRiN) International Development Assistance (IDA) programme. The programme is a long-term investment to build and sustain national nutrition programme for the Government of Nigeria. ANRiN aims to increase utilisation of quality, cost-effective nutrition services for pregnant and lactating women, adolescent girls and children under-5 years of age in 12 of Nigeria’s 36 States. It has been designed to support the effective delivery of Nigeria’s National Policy on Food and Nutrition.
